name: Snake Game
description: Snake Game is simple spin and move game. Players are moving along snake body with 54 stops. The first player, who reaches the 54th space wins the game.

name: Emergents: Genesis – The Deckbuilding Game
description:
Emergents: Genesis is a PvP multi-player superhero-themed deckbuilding game, set in the Emergents Universe created by game designer and comic creator, Brian David-Marshall and features art from a host of best-selling and award-winning comic book artists headlined by Steve Ellis.

Emergents: Genesis is a 2-4 player deckbuilding game that any age can enjoy, and a game lasts generally between 30-60 minutes. Everything you will need to play the game comes inside a box of Emergents: Genesis.

In Emergents: Genesis, players take on the role of powerful superheroes—known in this world as Emergents—and battle against the other players in the game to be the last person standing.

Players customize their decks based on four classes of superpowers in a fast-paced game that can be played by two to four players. Designed by Urban Island Games and Top8Magic, Emergents: Genesis introduces innovative, interactive mechanics to the deckbuilding game that will appeal to all fans of both the superhero genre and interactive card games.

Gameplay Description

Players are dealt two Emergents face down and choose one of the heroes to start the game with. The object of the game is reduce all of the other players' heroes to zero health by attacking them while also building your deck and customizing your Emergent's superpowers.

Each player begins with a deck containing nine Skill cards and three Attack cards. Cards that generate Skill are used to purchase additional cards while cards that generate Attack are used to defeat your opponents.

Each player shuffles their deck and draws six cards. They can purchase basic cards that advance their Emergent's class strategy or purchase more expensive cards that are available dealt face-up from the deck. Cards that are purchased get put in the player's discard pile and whenever a player can't draw a card they shuffle their deck. At the end of each turn, a player discards their hand and draws six cards from their deck.

As the game progresses, players will ideally create a deck that showcases their heroes' unique abilities and allows them to be the last player standing. While many deckbuilding games are points races, where someone crosses a finish line and wins, Emergents: Genesis requires you to defeat your opponents, which means you can defend yourself if you have purchased the right cards along the way.

name: Over The Line
description: Pick Card! Act or Draw Card! Guess Card! A combination of Charades and Pictionary onto the words are...Over The Line. A Cards Against Humanity style game. Ultimate party game for friends and family that goes too far, too soon, too often.

name: Noches de Sangre
description:
Noches de Sangre (Bloody Nights) is a semi-cooperative card game in which players have to survive a vampire attack over thirty nights.

Each turn, players will be able to pick up some items to be stronger, rescue survivors to join their team, find food for feeding them and even get inside new buildings for searching new adventures! But take care of your belongings, the world is full of pickpockets...

After player's turn, vampires will attack the group, so be ready! Roll a d6 and try to hit them as strong as you can. If you fail, be prepared to suffer consequences...

Surviving until the sun comes out is not enough: the one who rescued more people will be the winner. Who will it be?

name: Horse Party
description:
Help put together a barnwarming party and make sure everyone has a good time!

Dipsy Dipsy, Ice Cream Delivery Mare Extraordinaire, has just purchased a brand new barn to live in. And you know what that means – barn warming party! There’s just one small problem: she forgot to send out the invitations! Fortunately you (and your opponent) have agreed to help, by gathering all of Dipsy’s friends and customers. All you need to do is make sure that the guests arrive in proper groups and help them to bring the right gifts and and make sure someone brings the gifts and…Oh dear!

The objective of the game is to create complete sets of guests and gifts, and then to claim the set when completed. Players take turns playing a guest and or a gift on a set until it is completed. Each guest requires at least one other guest and up to two gifts in order for the set to be complete. The player who completes the set collects it, and the player who collects the most cards by the end of the game wins!

name: Fur Pile
description:
The object of Fur Pile is, like real life, to get the hook-up.
But like real life, this is easier said than done!

Throughout the game, players match up beautiful young furry femmes with appropriate partners and toys to ensure they have a good evening of fun. Every girl’s needs (partners and toys) must be met, and the winner of each “set” is the player who completes the set - leaving no need unfilled. A winning set (including girls and toys) is placed in that player’s Victory Pile. When sunrise comes, the player with the most cards in their Victory Pile wins the game.

Designed by Roland Guiscard and featuring easy to learn rules, quick game play, and exclusive artwork from furry artists Catwolf and En Den!

name: Insight Out
description:
Insight Out is "the game that gets your family talking."

From the box:
"The easy-to-learn format is perfect for any child age 3 or older.  Two sets of age-appropriate question cards promote communication and discussion with children of any age."

Insight Out is a roll-and-move game in which players move their cards along a track, drawing cards and answering questions or performing actions based on the spaces they land on.  Questions are designed to stimulate discussion among family members, and there are two levels--for younger and older children.  If a player chooses not to answer the question or do the action drawn, he or she may go back to the original space and re-roll once.  If the re-roll also results in drawing a card, then the player must do the action on the card or go back to the original space and lose his or her turn.  The winner is the first player to reach the Finish space.

An advanced game adds a few extra rules, such as spaces where cards may be given to another player and the need to roll the exact number to land on the finish space.

name: Domino Discovery Fractions
description:
From the box:
"Domino Discovery is an exciting matching game that reinforces basic learning skills and provides hours of fun.  It is an easy and creative way to involve children in learning activities."

Domino Discovery Fractions is an educational take on Dominoes, with the added element of requiring players to recognize and match equivalent fractions as well as fractions expressed as numbers and as pictures.  From a total of 40 dominoes, each player is dealt five and one starting domino is placed on the table.  In turn, each player must find a domino with a fraction that matches one end of a domino already in play, and play their domino against that one.  If they have not matches, they must draw from the draw pile until they can play a domino.  Play ends when one player successfully plays all their dominoes.

In order to play successfully, players must use their knowledge of equivalent fractions (such as 1/2 = 2/4) as well as understanding visual representations of fractions (such as knowing that a picture of a circle with one of three pieces colored in is equal to 1/3).

name: Space Station Disaster
description:
Space Station Disaster is a light strategy game. You and your opponents are building a space station by laying out hex tiles. But most of the tiles contain disasters like aliens, radiation, and fire. Your goal is to use matching equipment cards to fix the disasters. If you fix a disaster you get a point. If you don’t have the right equipment you’ll have to run away or risk being injured and losing points. The game starts off easy but soon you will be cornered by disease and mad robots hoping to draw a teleport tile to escape.

Through clever tile placement, strategic movement and a bit of luck you try and fix more disasters than your opponents before the space station is finished.

The game plays in 30-60 minutes depending on the number of players. With a different order of tiles each game you get a unique experience every time.

name: Citizen Cane
description:
Citizen Cane is a dice-drafting game in which 2-4 Christmas elves vie to build their gift-building empires!

Each turn, players roll a die for each elf on their team with up to two re-rolls - then all the rolled dice are pooled and players draft the numbers they want for that turn. Dice are spent to join elf unions that grant players special abilities, buy things with candy-cane currency at the quartermaster's stores or get on with the work of building, wrapping and tagging gifts for Santa.

Citizen Cane is a single-sheet game that relies only on a few items most gamers will already have around the house, and is intended to be printed on the inside face of Christmas cards for gamers.

name: Symtactics
description:
Symtactics is a simulation of tactical urbanism set in the Hong Kong region in the year of 2047. It involves both tactical as well as strategic decision making. It was printed in an edition of 20,000 for the Hong Kong edition of the New City Reader which was created specifically for the 'Uneven Growth' exhibition on view at the Museum of Modern Art from Nov 22, 2014 to May 10, 2015.

Ideally, Symtactics is played with 5 players. All players must complete tactical interventions at 8 sites around the Hong Kong region while dealing with catastrophic events. Players can either play for a collective win, working together to beat an ever increasing inequality meter or they can play individually.

Interventions are created by matching resource cards to icons printed on the site hexes. A player must successfully match three icons or use wildcard resources as dictated by the current round's market situation. Once an intervention is completed, the resources used go into a pile as marked on the board. There are 8 piles that correspond to the sites on the map and another 8 towards the north of the board, corresponding to the development of global inequality.

name: Zombie Run!

The player with the lowest number of zombies chasing them after five rounds wins and successfully escapes the town. Zombie Run combines memory with luck and is the ultimate card game for kids with braaaaaaaaaaaaains!"

Zombie Run! is a hand-comparison game with elements of memory (since you're only allowed to look at two cards from your hand per turn). After rounds of swapping a card drawn from the stock or waste with a card from the hand, any player may call for a showdown. All hands are compared and lowest takes the round.

name: That's Mine
description:
Choose your card wisely, then wager victory points to gain the advantage over your competition.

The game of rock, paper, scissors has been played in various forms for hundreds of years. That's Mine is a fast paced time filler game that adapts this enduring mechanic to a card game. It adds support for more than two players and introduces a risk/reward wagering element.

Each round involves all players choosing a numbered card with rock, paper or scissors and resolving battle as expected. Things get interesting when players wager existing victory points to influence when they enter the competition. Every hand is resolved leaving only one winner with a simple yet decisive tiebreaking system.

Each wager builds the kitty and the survivor exclaims "That's Mine" while claiming their winnings.

name: Before Scotland: 750 AD – Kingdoms
description:
Set in 8th century Northern Britain, Before Scotland: 750 AD - Kingdoms is a tactical combat deck building strategy game. It is historical in nature with a rich context and set of mechanics drawn from original sources.

The game begins in 750 AD and lets you play as one of four nations who struggle for supremacy: the Angles, Britons, Gaels, or Picts. After choosing a leader and moral cause that give special abilities to your kingdom, each player draws up to 7 random cards from their Kingdom Reserve deck. They travel through the Environment and scout the Terrain at the battlefield; these are event cards that alter the impending engagement. From the cards-in-hand (i.e. the Warband), each player may select up to 3 Warband Unit cards that face-off with a competing kingdom. After a simultaneous reveal, cards are resolved one-versus-one with additional Supply, Tactics, or Training cards from the Warband that are used to modify the encounter. Winning cards enter the Hoard. Losing cards are flushed into the Barrow. The game ends when the Kingdom Reserves are exhausted and the player with the largest hoard wins.

This game is targeted at the casual gamer and is a gateway to the more in-depth title Before Scotland: 750 AD - Empires which layers in a working economy and geographic constraints.

name: Love Letter: The Hobbit – The Battle of the Five Armies
description:
Love Letter: The Hobbit – The Battle of the Five Armies is a game of risk, deduction, and luck for 2–4 players based on the original Love Letter game by Seiji Kanai. The deck consists of 17 cards, with the Arkenstone being valued #8, Bilbo Baggins #7, and so on down to The One Ring at #0.

In each round, each player starts with only one card in hand; one card is removed from play. On a turn, you draw one card, and play one card, using the power on that card to expose others and (possibly) knock them out of the round. If you're the final player active in the round or the player with the highest card when the deck runs out, then you score a point. In LL: The Hobbit, The One Ring does nothing during play, but it counts as a #7 when the game ends, possibly leading to a tie should someone else hold Bilbo.

In addition to the one extra card, LL: The Hobbit differs from the original game in that the Baron (#3) is represented by two separate cards: Tauriel and Legolas. When you use an elf's power to compare cards, Tauriel knocks out the player with the higher valued card while Legolas targets the lower valued card. (This change isn't in the German edition, where Legolas and Tauriel have the same text.)

Whoever first wins 4-7 rounds, with the number dependent on the number of players, wins the game!

name: Panic: War of the Khan Succession
description:
In fighting off the Western Xia, Genghis Khan died a sudden illness. The golden head of the family had not time to establish a successor to the empire. Now each surviving prince ranked himself heir to the empire. When word of the Khan's death spread throughout Eurasia, the princes went to war to establish their worthiness.

Play Introduction: 
1. Place the map on the center of the table. 
2. Separate the 4 different region cards and shuffle the each stack, then place each stack on the corresponding position on the map.
3. Mix troops in their draw bag. 
4. Prepare an discard area. 
5. Each player takes a corresponding color screen and 10 tokens, and then randomly takes six troops card from the bag, and places behind their screen as the starting Standby Force

The game takes place over several battles. The first player to win a  battle to earns the first player token (the Scarecrow).
In order, the players choose cards from the four regions where the battle will take place. Each battle takes place in player sequence, and takes place in 3 stages.  After the 3rd stage of the battle is complete, a new region card is turned over, and play continues until a victor is declared.

Victory conditions: 
   In a 4-player game, if a player occupies 3 areas the game is over immediately, and the player wins the game; in a 2-3 player game, if a player occupies the four areas the game is over immediately, the player wins the game

name: Exalted of Kalos
description:
Save Kalos.  Work as a team - but look out for yourself.

These are the concerns in Exalted of Kalos.  Monsters pour from the wilderness, trying to overrun the land.  Your group, the mightiest heroes in Kalos, must stop this invasion.  After the invaders (and at least one deadly "boss") are routed, only one of your number will be granted the title "Exalted of Kalos".

Exalted of Kalos finds the sweet-spot in between several gaming styles.  It is easy to learn, even for beginners.  At the same time, experience and tactics play a vital role.  EoK plays much like a "board collapser" cooperative game - where the players work together against automated challenges.  However, it also gives each individual their own agenda.

Players each take control of a character with their own strengths and weaknesses.  Players must manage power and timing to make the most of their turns.  This is crucial, not only in surviving as a group, but in making themselves stand out individually.

name: Bang the Button!!!
description:
Bang the Button!!! is an educational  and interactive game that has been developed for learners of English as a foreign language for beginner levels. (Starters, A1 and A2, according to the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR)).

It is a unique, very complete game that can (and should) be used as a complement to any method (digital or more traditional) that is used in the classroom. Playing the game at home is of course also great fun!

Especially the oral skills (speaking and listening) are trained in this game that is played in small groups (3 – 6 players). The game allows a lot of interaction between the players, exactly what we want in foreign language teaching.
The game is also very useful for getting rid of the usual shyness that many learners feel. The game is very challenging and educational.

The game Bang the Button is, as mentioned above, very complete and includes a variety of aspects, such as:

     vocabulary
     grammar
     communication
     culture
     movement
     interaction
     constant participation of all players
     a healthy dose of competion

name: Scepter
description:
Think of it as Magic: the Gathering meets Monopoly.

You and your party protect you homeland, and win your opponent's scepter.  This is a game of battling special abilities to obtain land, pour magic into your land with magic stones.

You will build decks of creature, item and spell cards.  You begin the game by building a deck of about 20 cards.  Player tokens begin on zero, as well as the starting castle, on the board.  Each player starts with 7 cards from the starter deck.  You can do each of the following once per turn:

1. Take 2 cards from your deck, keep one, place the 2nd on the bottom of the draw deck.
2. Use 1 spell card.
3. Roll the dice to move your token on the board.
4. Perform and action, such as summoning creatures (up to their required land value).
5. Pay the toll to another player if you land on their space.
6. Discard down to 7 cards.

Just remember Draw, Roll, Play a card.  When you land on an empty space, you will fill it with one of your creature cards.  When you land on a space already occupied by an opponent, you pay a toll or play a creature to battle it.  Prior to battle, player can equip their creatures with items.

The goal is to obtain the most land.

name: Jumpgate Armada
description:
Jumpgate Armada is a sci-fi themed action packed 2-4 player board game, where you control one of two federation called Alpha or Omega. Take control of your federation ships to perform assaults against your opponent while gathering a valuable resource called type 12 ore, collected by each player's mining ships.

Each player also plays jumpgate cards, where dangerous events can take place. Experience ships being pulled inside black holes, unknown parasites liquefying and absorbing a player's ship or evaporated by the mysteries monoliths. Don't blink your eyes or you will be struck by asteroids, comets and meteorites then destroyed!

Smile at your opponent by obtaining tracker beams, shield restorers, bonus attack modifiers and experience the power of a super nova penetrating every ship in play and disabling their shields to 50 % or destroying them!

Jumpgate Armada is full of excitement, twists, and turns. Offering memorable laughs with your friends and family. Where Anything can happen. So climb aboard, buckle up, and brace yourself for the many adventures Jumpgate Armada will take you to!

name: Sapiens
description:
The time has come for the tribe to leave its shelter and head for new lands. As the chief of your clan, it's up to you to guide your prehistoric people through the valley: Take advantage of the environment, pick and hunt for food, discover big and safe caverns for the upcoming winter, gather your tribe and discover the valley!

Sapiens is a short and easy-to-learn tile-placement game that can prove much deeper than it seems for gamers. Each player has a personal game board that represents the valley on which they will play tiles to determine the journey of their tribe through several prehistoric life scenes. Their aim is to gather food points on the plains and in the forests of the valley and to get shelter points for reaching caves in the mountains. A player's turn consists of two steps:


    Connect one new tile from the four in his personal pool to the tiles already in play on his board, with connected scenes needing to match. These placements earn food points when a connection is made, earns shelter points when a cave is reached, and sometimes provides a special ability based on the connected scenes.
    Choose a new tile from the five available in a common pool to re-fill his personal pool to four tiles.


Sapiens relies on instinctive domino-like mechanisms that are improved by interesting twists:


     Laying tiles on personal (modular) game boards brings a bit of a puzzle feel to the game.
     Having two separate scores — food and shelter — and knowing that only their lower one matters when determining who wins confronts players with interesting needs and dilemmas.
     Including special powers linked to the eight different scenes represented on the tiles brings a lot of interaction and choices.

name: Kaputt!

Kaputt is a strategy wargame -sort of 'postmodern soccerchess'– with the essencial difference that the board itself is always changing, giving a completely different experience each time you play this hilarious and surprising battle.

Configure your soldiers. Attack and/or move with them and carry the time-bomb to the enemy's headquarters. Do it carefully, so the opponent can't stole it from you and make your strategy a nightmare!

Walk on a battlefield composed by 133 mixed pieces full of surprises: mines, tunnels (they transport you to other tunnels!), ruins, barricades and incognito fields. Ruins and incognito fields which make you draw the most bizarre cards you've ever heard of.

Winning will be the most hilarious experience with «Kaputt».

name: Turbo Rally Card Racing: Thunder Track
description:
THUNDER TRACK takes careful planning, patience, wit, and a healthy dose of foresight to become a champion. Get too far ahead and you'll become everyone's target. Fall too far back and you might not be able to catch up by the end of the race. Waste all your RPMs and Ammo and you may not have them when you need them most. With plenty of surprises around every corner, only the driver who knows how to react quickly—and carefully—will head home with a trophy.

Building on the platform established by Turbo Rally Card Racing, THUNDER TRACK introduces a whole new level of strategy into the mix! Using your own 1:64 scale die-cast cars, race opponents along rally themed card tracks that you create. The cards are expandable so you can challenge unlimited players and build courses as simple or as big as you can imagine.

On your turn, flip one track card over, and follow the signs as you race through jumps and obstacles toward the finish line—all while fending off attacks from your opponents. The first player to reach the winner's circle wins one of five trophies—and an advantage in the next race!

But don't think for a second that getting to the Winner's Circle is easy. With over 30 RPM (Radical Performance Maneuvers) cards that allow players to boost ahead, burst through obstacles or sabotage opponents, THUNDER TRACK shifts racing strategy into high gear. Whether it's smokescreens and straightaways or pit stops and pace notes, the right RPM combo at the right time will keep your foot on the gas and your opponents off-track.

If tire spikes and land mines can’t seem to keep your fellow racers from taking the top spot in the winner’s circle, don’t worry, we’re also introducing 10 different weapons to choose from. Send your opponents skidding off track with a missile attack or drag them into the dirt and leave them stranded with a well-aimed grappling hook. But, whichever weapon you choose, you’ll have access to unique special abilities and features sure to keep your opponents eating your dust.

Think you've got what it takes to be a Turbo Rally Card Racing Champion? Only the toughest will survive the new THUNDER TRACK...

name: Before Scotland: 750 AD – Empires
description:
Set in 8th century Northern Britain, Before Scotland: 750 AD - Empires is an epic economy-based tactical-combat strategy game. It is historical in nature with a rich context and set of mechanics drawn from original sources.

The game begins in 750 AD and lets you play as one of four kingdoms who struggle for supremacy: the Angles, Britons, Gaels, or Picts. After choosing a Leader and Moral Cause that give special abilities to your kingdom, each player works through four seasons each year: planning, deployment, battle, and recovery. During planning season, you collect tax revenues, recruit troops, and identify battle targets. During deployment season, you muster Warbands, travel the environment, and scout the terrain. During battle season, you engage opponents in battle and resolve individual skirmishes. During recovery season, you pay maintenance, retreat units and reinforce adjacent territories.

Actions in each phase affect the outcome of the next phase. For example, by travelling the Environment and scouting the Terrain during deployment season; you will alter the engagements in battle season. The battle system requires each player to select up to 3 Warband Unit cards, from their hand, that face-off with competing kingdoms. After a simultaneous reveal, cards are resolved one-versus-one with additional Supply, Tactics, or Training cards from the Warband, and purchased during planning season, that are used to modify the encounter. Winning cards remain at the settlement. Losing cards are returned to the Kingdom Reserve and must be re-purchased to re-enter the game. The game ends after 5 (shorter), or 10 (longer), years of in-game play and the remaining player with the highest net-worth wins.

This game is targeted at the serious strategy gamer and it is an in-depth title that combines deck-building, a working economy and geographic constraints.

name: Deep Sea Adventure
description:
A group of poor explorers hoping to get rich quickly heads out to recover treasures from some undersea ruins. They're all rivals, but their budgets force them all to share a single rented submarine. In the rented submarine, they all have to share a single tank of air, as well. If they don't get back to the sub before they run out of air, they'll drop all their treasure. Now it's time to see who can bring home the greatest riches.

Game Objective
The game takes place over 3 rounds, and the player to gain the most points over the 3 rounds is the winner. In order to gain points, you must bring the most ruins chips back to the submarine. You can only return to the submarine once per round, and you cannot progress more after returning. You cannot return to the submarine without bringing any ruins chips.

Turn Progression
On their turns, players conduct steps 1-4 listed below. Players take turns, going clockwise around the board, and the round ends when all players have returned to the submarine, or if the air runs out at the beginning of someone's turn.

1) Declare if you will turn back or not.
2) Reduce air.
3) Roll the dice and advance your game piece.
4) Search. (When you have stopped moving, select one of A-C below)
     A) Do nothing.
     B) Pick up ruins chip.
     C) Place a ruins chip.

name: Higamus Hogamus
description:
Higamus Hogamus is a card game where the players must match pairs of cards that combine to make compound words.  Each player is dealt six cards.  On their turn, they may either draw a card from the draw pile or take a card from another player's hand.  They then look in their hand for any pairs that make words (such as "cow" and "boy") and lay them down.  There are also "Higamus" and "Hogamus" cards depicting the titular pigs that are worth bonus points but must be announced when drawn (so other players can draw from their hands to try to steal the points) and Krazy Kat and Holy Cow cards that deduct points.

A round ends when either any player runs out of cards or a player holds both Higamus and Hogamus in his or her hand.  Players score one point for each card they have laid down, five points each for Higamus or Hogamus and negative five points each for Holy Cow and Krazy Kat.

An alternate version of the game allows players to ask other players for specific cards and play either cards that form compound words or matching cards.  In this version, Krazy Kat and Holy Cow are a match as are Higamus and Hogamus.

name: The Creditor's Deal
description:
The Creditor's Deal is a card game created by the Frandzel & Share law firm as a gift for their clients.  The theme is building a portfolio of loans.

Each player is dealt seven cards, and the rest of the cards go into a draw pile.  On their turns, players check their hands for completed loans (a loan card and matching collateral card, or these two plus a guaranty card for higher-value loans) and then lay the cards down face-down in their portfolio.  They then either draw a card from the draw pile or take the top card from the face-up discard pile.  If they have more than seven cards, they must now discard down to seven.

Other cards can help complete loans, take away money, steal card from other players, steal or protect completed loans or cause another player's loan to be auctioned.

The game ends when the draw pile is gone.  Players add the value of all their completed loans and subtract regulatory or legal fee cards and any unplayed completed loans they hold.  The player with the highest total wins.

name: Hooked on Spelling Card Game
description:
From the box:
"Practice spelling skills by creating words with Beginning and Ending game cards. The first player to play all ten cards wins."

Players are dealt ten cards each. Each card has either a beginning or ending of a word--generally 1-3 letters. The dealer turns over the top card of the draw deck. The first player must then make a word by adding either a beginning or end card, as appropriate. The next player may then either cover the beginning or ending of the played word with one of their own cards to make a new word. If a player is unable to play a card, he or she passes to the next player. If no player can make a new word, another card is drawn from the draw pile to replace the beginning or ending card and play resumes.

The first player to use all his or her card wins.

name: The Guardians: Explore
description:
It's spring break in Arthursburg, a time when kids set out on heroic quests of excitement and imagination. But this year, the danger and magic are real - the residents and wildlife around town have been transformed into evil monsters bent on total destruction!

Only you and your friends have the power and wits to rise up and save your loved ones from this unknown evil.

To defeat the monstrous hordes that are spreading chaos and evil everywhere they go.

To become the legendary heroes who will save the people of Arthursburg.

THE GUARDIANS!

The Guardians: Explore is a card drafting, deck refinement adventure game for 2-5 players, running eight total turns, and games lasting approximately 45-90 minutes long. It's broken down into two chapters; Warm Up and Battle.

Players begin their Warm Up with a card draft that shapes their strategy for the battle to come.  A unique super card is selected in secret to give each player their own special strength and two unique missions provide optional goals.

Now fortified with equipment, skills, and familiars, the players begin the Battle!  By drawing and cleverly playing cards from the top of their deck, players build the power needed to defeat monsters and acquire trophies with each turn.

During play, unneeded cards can be thrown away and powerful locations can be fortified with blanket forts to prepare player's for the final showdown. Work together to defeat the mighty boss at the heart of the monster invasion and save Arthursburg!

name: Taksikuski
description:
A Finnish board game classic from the 1980s in which the players take the role of taxi drivers in an imaginary town. The aim is to collect as much money as possible.

Players start from the taxi station of their choice. Everyone picks up a customer and an address from the yellow customer deck. The taxi fee is determined by counting the spaces between the destination and the current location of the taxi car. Now, all the players must reach their destinations on the map by throwing two 6-sided dice and moving according to them on the board. When a customer reaches his destination, the player must pick up a red destination card: Will the customer be able to pay after all? Or will he even tip you some extra? Or maybe rob you of half of your money?

After successfully completing a trip, the players return to a taxi station to pick up a new customer. Whoever has the most money after a predetermined time or other limit (e.g. end of deck) is declared the winner.

name: Cannibal Squares
description:
A Fight or Flight game where you fight to survive, build an SOS sign and try to live till rescue. Be careful, night brings Cannibals.

Collect food, resources, weapons and tools while you fight (or flee) for your life in the Cooperative (or Solo) Survival Game.

In this epic survival game you play the role of a crash survivor who washed up on a beautiful island. Without food or water you need to collect food, build tools, craft weapons and gather stones for an SOS sign. I mean, how else is rescue going to find you?

While wondering the island you learn a few things, food is scarce, resources and equipment are hard to come by and nothing is what it seems.

As night falls and a breathtaking sunset fills the sky, a weird mist seems to roll in off the coast. From the mist you see these things emerge. Human like figures stagger, crawl and sprint towards you. You don't know what you are about to face, do you fight or flee?

Game Play

Players take turns moving their pawns around the island and using action points. They use these points to collect food and resources. Using a crafting system you can make weapons and tools to help you survive.

The game is played over the course of a Day and Night rounds. In the day rounds, You can wonder freely, but when night comes around, your actions are limited as well as your movement. With the setting sun, you will also start spawning numerous Cannibals around the island on specifically designated spawning locations.

You can either fight Cannibals by rolling die, or run around them. By day break, cannibals will disappear into the forests until next night fall. As you finish your SOS sign, the island and cannibals will become more aggressive. Get off the island quick, but don't leave yourself vulnerable.

The goal of the game is to get off the island alive and with as many people as possible. It is possible to be left behind, but the game is easier if you work together.

name: Heldentaufe
description:
The day that you have been waiting for has come. At last, you can prove that you are worthy of being a member of the Hero‘s council. Show them your skills by collecting the golden monster teeth. But be aware - the lands of Taora are not as peaceful as they seem. Rumor has it, that in the dark and gloomy Netherworld, some friends become enemies...

Now get up and hurry! The Heldentaufe already started. Be the first who returns the teeth of glory.

The unique experience of Heldentaufe arises due to two distinct but connected realms: The Upper world and the Netherworld. Heroes can travel back and forth to the separate worlds through so-called "portals".

Events and activities taking place in the Upper world are mostly serene and peaceful. You will harvest natural goods, carry out missions and trade items that you find. Somewhere hidden in the Netherworld lies a bright and shiny treasure. But what underworld would be complete without monsters and traps?

Players will change perspective frequently since they not only have to tell their hero which move to make next, but also command the monsters in the Netherworld, as soon as an opponent enters the dark realm. In a game with three or four players, forging an alliance to increase a player's odds in combat against monsters can be a smart choice. However, players should choose their swordmates wisely - once unearthed, the treasures of the Netherworld might lead even their most trusted allies to suddenly turn against them...

Due to the two distinctly different worlds, both aggressive warmongers and pacifistic characters will embrace the gameplay of Heldentaufe.

Heldentaufe is easy to learn and lets you experience all the key elements of a true adventure role-playing game (discovering treasures, collecting items, completing missions, and battling monsters).

A game for tactical players who can count on their luck in critical situations.

name: Wizard Battle
description:
Wizard Battle is a competitive strategy game for two or more Wizards and one Wizard Overseer, who runs the game. Dominate other Wizards in the field of Wizard Battle through your magical and mental might! Battle takes place over a series of turns in which Wizards privately perform their actions, all the while engaging in secret diplomacy with one another; cunning and ruthlessness will get you everywhere. All consequences are described simultaneously by the Overseer, as every Wizard can watch their fate - good or bad - unfold. But it's not set in stone, as time manipulating magics allow diabolical flexibility. Ultimately, at the end of the Wizard Battle, the Wizard not yet blown to pieces or driven insane wins access to the Wish spell and the title of #1 Wizard!

Features:


    Outwit your opponents for the title of #1 Wizard and access to the Wish spell.

    Easily playable anywhere, including online, because there are no physical pieces.

    Time travel to previous turns to change your actions.
    Diplomatic gameplay where you make or break alliances as you need.

    Playable against Satan for the rights to your immortal soul.

name: A.I.M. Agents for Infiltration and Mayhem
description:
Every government needs a secret team for spying, hacking and destruction
A.I.M:- Agents for Infiltration and Mayhem

Agents for Infiltration and Mayhem are a team of special agents with a variety of skills and talents. Different combinations of the A.I.M. team are deployed for different mission.

Your mission, should you decide to accept it, will be to defeat all the challenges thrown at you and save the world.

In A.I.M. you play a secret “off the books” government agency who are given deniable missions to achieve.

Think A-Team meets Mission: Impossible meets Charlie’s Angels meets Man from Uncle. Here is your chance to re-create those great TV and film shows for yourself.

Gameplay
A.I.M. is a deck builder game. You select one or more roles and mission scenarios and a small starting deck. As the game progresses you develop your deck of talents, weapons and equipment. You will face increasingly stronger challenges: locks, thugs & military teams, computers to hack, people to charm and confuse.

As you overcome challenges you earn the ability to collect additional cards from the Quarter-Master.

But you must beware of other agents hidden agendas and possible plot-twists that will really test your abilities.

Every agent has their own agenda, it may be to protect the other agents, to make more money, to progress further – or maybe they will have to betray the team…

name: Airship Assassin
description:
This is Captain Fredericks of the Graf Zeppelin.   We shall shortly be concluding our New York to London transatlantic flight.   I would hope to wish you to enjoy your trip, however we have had word from the secret service that we have a King and an Assassin on board.  The King is travelling incognito for his security. we do not know who the King is. The Assassin is also unknown to us.  You must find and identify the assassin before our voyage is over.

Each guest at your party takes on a role, maybe Diamond Thief,  Body Snatcher, Police Inspector, Hypnotist and more. Each card has certain powers and lets you look at another players card. In that way, each guest can work the room until they can identify the Assassin and the King.  BUT! Players can swap cards – so who you thought was the Assassin might be someone else by the time the game ends!

There can be several winners. If you have met your personal objective – as set on the card you hold at the end of the game – you are a winner. Also, if you can identify the Assassin – you are a winner

This game is a variation on the idea and mechanics first seen in 2 Rooms and a Boom, but re-engineered for longer and more free-from party play.

The pack of 60 cards is available for download and print and play.

In addition, you will need to link to one of the sound files which acts as a timer through the game.

Select the sound file you want depending on how long you want the game to last.

You can play the sound file direct from the website, or you can download it for playing on PC, tablet or MP3 player.

name: Paw Patrol Beach Rescue Play Mat Game
description:
A storm has hit Adventure Bay and scattered everything on the beach! Help the Pups put things back in order. Find and return the most items to win!

Paw Patrol Beach Rescue is a very simple pick up and deliver game for young children. The object of the game is to earn the most treats. On your turn, guide your pup from Lookout Tower all the way to the beach by driving along the roads. Once there, pick up a mystery token. Find out where it belongs by matching the image on the token to the image on the mat. Place the token in your pup's vehicle and drive it to the correct location on the mat.  Place the token in its spot on the mat and collect a treat if one is available.  Lastly, drive the treat back to Lookout Tower and place it in your parking spot.

There are more mystery tokens than there are treats, so you may not collect a treat after every delivery.  Also, some tokens are worth three treats right away and do not need to be delivered. Once the beach is clear of mystery tokens the game ends and the player with the most treats wins.

name: The Game of Life: My Little Pony
description:
Spring had sprung in Equestria. As the days grew longer and the weather grew hotter, Princess Celestia realized it was getting closer and closer to the Summer Sun Celebration. But there was so much to prepare in Equestria! So, she did what any good leader would do: she delegated! And now you and your friends can play as Ponies as you help prepare Equestria for the party in My Little Pony Game of Life.

My Little Pony Game of Life sets players on a course preparing Equestria, but also learning the importance of friendship. You'll gain friends and earn Friendship Points, which will help you overcome obstacles, find supplies for the celebration, and get back to Ponyville in enough time to party down. Plus, you get four collectible Pony pieces, different from (but in the same scale as) the pieces in My Little Pony Monopoly (so all the Ponies can play together). My Little Pony Game of Life proves that the most important things in life are the friends you make along your journey through it. Awwww.

name: Goodnight Goodnight, Construction Site: The Game
description:
Cooperative game based off the children's book by the same name.

Work together to put all the construction vehicles to bed before the sun sets.

Includes game board, 5 truck movers, dice tower with sun/moon dial, and game die.

Roll the die and move any construction vehicle the number of spaces on the die.  If you reach a work space you must stop moving.  If you roll the sun, move the sun dial forward one space.  The game ends when every vehicle reaches their bed or the moon appears on the dial.

name: Odd 1 Out
description:
You or your team is trying to guess which of the four choices doesn't belong to the same category with others. You must also try to give the reason why it doesn't belong to that category. Categories can be nearly anything: members of pop groups, types of cheeses, different materials etc. You or your team gets two points for right guess and additional point for the right reason, which you can find from the card. The team that first gets to 15 points wins.

The game is deck of 60 cards in a nice tin box. Two cards has the rules and every other card has six different categories with four choices on each. Right answers are bolded, so the player reading the card, can't participate on that round.

name: War of Tanks: France 1940 – The Breakthrough at Dinant
description:
War of Tank: France 1940: The Breakthrough at Dinant, covers the very beginning of the infamous sickle cut, the incredible German blitz that would end two weeks later around Dunkirk.

On May 12th, Rommel, Hartlieb and their panzer divisions are on the bank of the Meuse River. And they’re not there for the fishing. In front of them, the French divisions are just starting to reach their position after a forced marche. And they don’t know exactly what to expect.
Rather than a large offensive and pitched battle, the battles that followed were a succession of chaotic attacks and counter-attacks, dashes forward, retreats and reorganizations.  The German breakthrough, as spectacular as it may have been, was the result of stubborn, bitter and costly fighting.

Freely inspired by the excellent Rommel at the Meuse, a game by Randy Moorehead published as a DTP by Simulations Workshop in 1995 - These are two very different games and systems, but the issues and the salient points of the battle had already been well thought out and built into RatM.

Published in Battles Magazine #10, 2015

Game Scale:
Game Turn: approx 4 hours
Hex: 1 miles / 1.6 kilometers
Units: Company to Regiment

Game Inventory:
One 18 x 33" full color map
Two dual-side printed countersheets (280 1/2" counters)
One 16-page Sedan rulebook

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 2-15

These include the best entries from the Shibumi Challenge game design contest, along with several solitaire puzzles and multi-player games.

name: 12+1 games for the Mystique Deck
description: The Mystique Deck is a special pack of 60 cards designed by Néstor Romeral Andrés and illustrated by Chechu Nieto. Each card has three primary attributes instead of just two: color, suit and number. Furthermore, each card is identified by a unique card number (1 – 60). The Mystique Deck is a framework for game design, card tricks, or whatever you like. This book features 12+1 games designed exclusively for this deck.

name: Yavalath & Co.
description: Yavalath is a board game with extremely simple rules, but an emergent twist that makes it interesting and fun to play. It came about as a result of the following question: can computers invent board games? This book features 15 games that can be played with a Yavalath set, including Yavalath itself. A Yavalath set consists of a hexagonal board of 5 hexes per side, 30 black stones, 30 white stones and at least 25 red stones.

name: Classic Gold Pop Trivia
description:
Pop trivia card game in a tin box. There is six categories of questions: 60's, 70's, 80's, Brit pop, Soul and Songs & Song writers. There is also one deck of questions with thematic picture. And last there is score sheet, pen and die. There is 2100 standard questions and 300 pictured questions.

Question master rolls the die and ask question corresponding to the number rolled. If player in turn answers correctly he/she gets a mark to that category. If the answer is wrong he/she gets nothing. In both cases he/she will be the next question master. Game goes on until one player has marked all categories. The player with most marks wins.

So what we do with the pictured cards? If question master rolls a six and player answers right, then he/she may request additional picture card question. Question master then asks all six questions on that card. Player gets extra points (number of right answer -2). He/she adds/subtracts the amount from category he/she already has marks. So category 6 (Songs & Song writers) seems to be more substantial than others.

name: Math! Leave Them Kids Alone!
description:
This game helps kids learn math by engaging multiple learning styles (Social, Visual, Verbal/Auditory, and Logical/Mathematical)  The game is won by collecting goal cards.  Goal cards are won by using mathematical operators to join cards in a grid into other cards which are set aside as goal cards.  The grid cards are revealed and re-hidden during the game, so there is a memory aspect as well.

The game can be played at multiple levels from early elementary (just learning addition and subtraction with two digit numbers) to teens who know multiplication and division well and are learning powers, roots, and the Fibonacci series.  Using a timer (not provided), you can handicap the game so that adults can play against young children.

The game teaches both regular numbers (1, 2, 3...) as well as Roman numbers.  All cards also use images of dice to help kids understand the connection between the abstract number and the quantity that it represents.  This can help anyone struggling with math, but it is especially helpful for certain special needs students.

The game was designed by a group of kids aged 10-15 as part of their First Lego League research project.  The game works well as a team game, if you have more than 6 players.

name: Big Nate's Detention Dash
description:
From the game box:
Based on the best selling Big Nate books, Detention Dash is a fun fast paced game!  Join middle-schooler Nate and his friends as they run from classroom to classroom collecting detention cards.  Along the way Coach John might surprise you!  The player with the fewest detention and fail cards wins.

Further information: Players must roll and move through the spaces representing hallways and classrooms.  Each player must collect a report card from each of six classrooms.  Along the way, they may get Detention cards in various ways, such as being caught in the hall when the bell rings or being caught by good student Artur. Each player must also draw and play an action card each turn.  Some cards allow extra moves, moving other players or discarding or taking extra detention cards.  Others are "Coach John All Play" cards which require all players to complete a physical challenge (such a making and flying a paper airplane). First player to get all six report cards discards two detention cards and then total detention and "fail" report cards are counted, "pass" report cards are subtracted and the player with the lowest total wins.

name: Moons
description:
Moons is a trick-taking card game in which suits are represented by different planets in our solar system, and card ranks are represented by the moons that orbit them.

Set Up
Separate all the planet tokens and place them off to one side of the table within reach of the players. (Saturn, Jupiter, Neptune and Uranus)
Remove all the scoring reference cards and give one to each player. Put any extra reference cards back in the box.
Shuffle all the small Asteroid cards and deal two to each player. Place the remaining Asteroid cards in a draw deck off to one side of the table within reach of the players.
Shuffle all the larger Moon cards and deal the whole deck out to the players one at a time in clockwise order.
Put the block token (red circle with a line through it) off to one side of the table within reach of the players.â€¨

Quick Playâ€¨
1. Complete the set up
2. All players create a face down three card tableau
3. All players reveal tableaus simultaneously
4. Highest card in tableau gains first player marker (first round only)
5. The first player may play an Asteroid card if he/she wishes
6. First player leads first trick by playing one Moon card
7. In clockwise order from the first player, all other players may play one Asteroid card if they
wish, and then must play one Moon card (must follow suit if able)
8. The player with the highest numbered on-suit card wins the trick and gains a planet token
that matches any suit in his/her tableau
9. The lowest off-suit card wins a token matching the off-suit played (if tied, low off-suits do not get a token)
10. The winner of the trick leads the next trick
11. After all cards have been played, the winner of the most tricks gains 1 planet token of their
choice (does not have to match tableau) — In the case of a tie, all tied players receive 1
token of choice
12. Players who earned zero tricks may take one token that matches any card in their tableau
13. Pass the first player token to the left (the Earth’s moon token) — the Earth token should
never be moved as it marks the starting point
14. The new first player deals out all cards for the next round and leads the first trick
15. Repeat until all tokens are gone or until all players have dealt one time

Players score points based on sets of tokens.

name: Mothership
description:
Humans have become the cheapest and most dependable sources of labor in the Deep Intersect, a far-out sector of the Polystellar Intersystem. And the outer system Space Law, the code of order that makes it illegal to abduct Humans, is poorly enforced.

Each player plays as one of four Alien species, each with a special power that will help them expand their control of the galaxy. Players must collect Flux Cores and abduct as many Humans as they can while expanding and maintaining their control of the galaxy.

On a turn, each player plays an Action card and assigns its Action Points. Then, the player rolls three Energy Cubes (dice) and 'burns' the Energy Value (pips) at the various Power Cores around the board or Species card. Players must collect Flux Cores (+1VP), which are needed to abduct Humans (+2VP) and explore the galaxy (+VP), in order to earn VPs and win the game.

Action Cards also have a Combat Bonus that can be applied in a Space Battle, where the struggle for control is most apparent. Each Alien species also has a unique species trait that is also applied in a Space Battle. Players also struggle for control of the galaxy in a tug-of-war fashion on the Control track.

When the last Human has been abducted, the game is over. The player with the most VPs wins. Ties are settled with one last Space Battle, with the current VPs included as a combat bonus.

Requires 3 (or more) dice, 4 tokens, and all included files.

name: Davy Jones' Poker
description:
From the Davy Jones' Poker English rules page:

Yo-ho-ho! Are there three of you here? Okay, let's gamble! Each of you take out two of something as chips for betting. The chips can be anything...candies, toys, coins, stones, etc. Who loves the ocean most between you three? He becomes the first dealer. Shuffle all cards well, and deal one card to each player. Do not show your card to anyone. Put the remaining card face down at the center of the table.

The first turn goes to the player to the right of the dealer and continues counter-clockwise. The active player decides to either PARLAY (trade cards with the player to their right) or KEEP (keep their currently held card). The next player does the same. If the third player chooses PARLAY, they change cards with the remaining card in the center of the table.

After each player has had one chance to PARLAY or KEEP, a countdown...3, 2, 1...is shouted and everyone reveals their card at the same time. The highest numbered card wins UNLESS both the 3 Card and the 0 Card have been revealed. In this case, reverse the order and the lowest numbered card wins! The player with the weakest card pays a chip to the center of the table.

Play more rounds until one player is out of chips. After that, the dealer deals 1 card to each player and 2 cards in a stack, face down to the center of the table. If a player chooses to PARLAY, they replace their card with the top card in the stack at the center of the table. Continue playing rounds until only one player remains and is declared the winner!

name: Born To Be Surrounded
description:
Born To Be Surrounded: Battle of Bastogne is a competitive introductory-level wargames covering the critical first six days of battle of bastogne.

name: Chepy
description:
Chepy is a mini version of Pawn's Shephy solitaire card game. It was released at Tokyo Game Market 2014 as a set of 4 postcards, 3 of which are the Chepy playing cards (6 per postcard) which must be cut out prior to playing. The last card is a double sided rules card. All cards are Japanese language only, unlike the dual language (ENG and JPN) Shephy.

The rules are basically the same as Shephy, but scaled down slightly. The player starts with one sheep in their field, and must manage the event cards presented to you in order to accumulate ONE HUNDRED sheep in the field before you go through the deck of event cards three times.

The sheep deck consists of values 1, 3, 10, 30, and 100; at the start of the game, you place a 1 sheep card in your field, then shuffle the event cards and lay out three cards to form your hand. On a turn, you choose one card, carry out its effect, then refill your hand to three cards. Event cards might duplicate existing sheep cards, add new ones, swap one value of sheep for another, remove sheep, etc. Play through the deck until you have no cards in hand, then shuffle the event cards.

If you go through the deck three times without having at least one 100 sheep card in the field or if at any point in the game you have no sheep in the field, then you lose.

name: Space Opera
description:
In a very, very likely future, in this very same galaxy…

Many intelligent species have learned to travel between the stars, developing the technology necessary for interstellar jumps. The first encounters between them did not go peacefully. During centuries, war and conflicts expanded affecting almost every corner in the galaxy.

During the longest part of the galactic history, different species used to settle on the systems they arrived to. Instead of just exploring the galaxy, they were sending their overpopulation to colonize new homes. That caused many wars, because it’s not easy to share your home planet with a foreign species who has nothing in common with you. But everything changed when The Plague arrived.

The Plague was an illness that affected all intelligent species all across the galaxy, decimating their population to the brink of extinction and ending wars.

Survivors of each species regrouped as well as they could and, following severe isolation protocols, finally the Plague was almost eradicated although their customs changed forever.

Since that day on, all species are nomads, because the void of space is the most aseptic environment, and they no longer settle on the systems they visit. The biggest part of the population stays on the surface of a planet the necessary time to get their  esources and nothing more.

Space Opera  is a card game for ages above 14. 2 to 4 players. Approximate duration of the game: between 30 and 90 minutes, depending on the number of players. Each player, represents an specie, fighting to achieve supremacy on the Galaxy (through the Extermination the other species or reaching Civilization Level 3 or more).

The game could be played with using all the same deck or could be played in a Competitive Mode. In Competitive Mode, every player have their own deck with the specie and 40 resources cards previously chosen.

name: War Eternal
description:
War Eternal is an epic strategy fantasy board game for 3-6 players in which players take on the roles of leaders of fantasy races fighting for the throne of ancient empire

War Eternal is played simultaneously, on a dynamic board that discourages "turtling". Players have to take terrain and change of season in account that greatly change in game conditions.
In game are introduced flexible magic system where depending on other factors spells can have various bonus effects, and rich economy system that gives every player possibility to play his race in many different ways.

name: Scythe
description:
It is a time of unrest in 1920s Europa. The ashes from the first great war still darken the snow. The capitalistic city-state known simply as “The Factory”, which fueled the war with heavily armored mechs, has closed its doors, drawing the attention of several nearby countries.

Scythe is an engine-building game set in an alternate-history 1920s period. It is a time of farming and war, broken hearts and rusted gears, innovation and valor. In Scythe, each player represents a character from one of five factions of Eastern Europe who are attempting to earn their fortune and claim their faction's stake in the land around the mysterious Factory. Players conquer territory, enlist new recruits, reap resources, gain villagers, build structures, and activate monstrous mechs.

Each player begins the game with different resources (power, coins, combat acumen, and popularity), a different starting location, and a hidden goal. Starting positions are specially calibrated to contribute to each faction’s uniqueness and the asymmetrical nature of the game (each faction always starts in the same place).

Scythe gives players almost complete control over their fate. Other than each player’s individual hidden objective card, the only elements of luck or variability are “encounter” cards that players will draw as they interact with the citizens of newly explored lands. Each encounter card provides the player with several options, allowing them to mitigate the luck of the draw through their selection. Combat is also driven by choices, not luck or randomness.

Scythe uses a streamlined action-selection mechanism (no rounds or phases) to keep gameplay moving at a brisk pace and reduce downtime between turns. While there is plenty of direct conflict for players who seek it, there is no player elimination.

Every part of Scythe has an aspect of engine-building to it. Players can upgrade actions to become more efficient, build structures that improve their position on the map, enlist new recruits to enhance character abilities, activate mechs to deter opponents from invading, and expand their borders to reap greater types and quantities of resources. These engine-building aspects create a sense of momentum and progress throughout the game. The order in which players improve their engine adds to the unique feel of each game, even when playing one faction multiple times.

name: Mosh Pit: The Card Game
description:
Mosh Pit: The Card Game is the fast paced game of hardcore moshing action!

Each player takes the role of a Mosher slamming, skanking and stage diving around the pit trying to prove themselves the coolest!

All players start the game with a hand of 3 Mosh cards, 3 COOL counters & 3 BRUISE counters, they then take it in turns drawing Mosh cards and playing Mosh cards from their hands, each card effects the players in some way, increasing or decreasing the amount of COOL or BRUISE Counters the players have in front of them as well as other game changing effects.

After every player has taken a turn a random Event card is played that effects the game even more.

After every card n the Mosh card deck has been drawn the game ends, Every player counts the amount of BRUISE Counters in front of them and minuses it from the amount of COOL Counters, the player with the most COOL Counters after this the player with the most COOL Counters wins and is the coolest mosher in the pit!!

name: Sail to Jipang
description:
In this roll-and-move minigame, players start in Europe and have to roll dice to sail their ships around Africa and Asia to reach Japan. On each turn, the active player may choose to either 1) roll the dice, or 2) pass. If the player rolls the dice, they choose 1 result and place a chip on that die spot. If there is already a chip there, they cannot choose that rolled die number.

A) If the chosen rolled die shows 2-6, that is the player's movement value. Move the pawn forward; each step costs as much as the number in the space being moved to. Repeat until you cannot move further. B) If the chosen die shows 1, the player's next movement value will be doubled.

After finishing A or B, return to choosing 1 or 2 again.

The winner is the first player to reach Japan!


    2 six-sided dice and player pawns are needed but not included with this postcard game.

name: Haspelknecht
description:
In Haspelknecht: The Story of Early Coal Mining, the first title in Thomas Spitzer's highly acclaimed Coal Trilogy, the players take upon the role of farmers with opportunities to exploit the presence of coal in their lands in the southern part of the Ruhr region of Germany.

The game is set during a time when the lands were mostly covered with forests and roads were rare. Coal was discovered here, close to the Earth's surface. During the game, players obtain knowledge about this new material, extend their farms, and dig deeper in the ground to extract more coal. The game has many paths that lead to victory.

Haspelknecht has an innovative action selection mechanism. You must select the correct tasks while being mindful of quickly accumulating pit water, for it can stall your efforts and prevent your extraction of valuable coal.

â€¨The game offers a lot of variation and replayability through unique methods in setting-up the development tiles.

name: Haithabu
description:
Haithabu is named after an important trading settlement located at the southern end of the Jutland Peninsula (on what's today the border of Denmark and Germany) that the Vikings used from the 8th to the 11th centuries. Its location on the Baltic and North Seas and on the trade routes between Scandinavia and the Frankish Empire led to goods from around the known world — such as the Baltics, Baghdad, and Constantinople — being traded here.

The subject of constant wars and changes of power, as well as the progressive Christianization of those in the north, Haithabu — known as "Hedeby" in English — had a rich history that ended in 1050 when the Norwegian king sacked and burned the town in a conflict with Denmark.

As Vikings, players trade with all the known world while also living through the changes and dark days at the end of the Early Middle Ages. In the game, players take turns performing individual actions on an action rondel, and what's most critical in the game is the timing of the actions because in each round each color of action can be selected only once. Players must react to market price changes and event dice that can cause complications.

Rules of Engagement

name: Attack on Omaha Beach
description:
This is a game created for the 18 Microgame Contest!

Players: 1
Ages 13+
Time: 15-20 Minutes

Attack on Omaha Beach follows a squad of American soldiers landing on Omaha Beach June 6th 1944! Your goal is to move up the beach avoiding obstacles and mines, to eventually get to the Pillbox and destroy it!

The game consists of phases and turns. You have a demolition engineer and a sniper to help you reach the pillbox.

You must use your Demo Engineer to destroy barriers in your way but don't use all your 6 demo charges or you won't be able to destroy the pillbox and you will lose!

The sniper can help remove German machine gun nests that will attack you while in the open. Your sniper only has 6 shots so make them count, after that you will be shot every time you move in the open or side to side without sight restrictions.

You will lay out a 3x3 grid of Beach Terrain card to create the beach assault and as you progress up the beach you will create a new beach assault 3 more times until you get to the pillbox.

name: Galactic Domination
description:
Galactic Domination is a conquest game where players compete to take over all the planets in the galaxy.  The galaxy includes board arranged in a grid (e.g., 10 x 10) and planets placed randomly on the board.

Players purchase ships, create population, attach each other, or make alliances with non-player races.

The core mechanic of the game is supply chain management.  The number of people represented by an unbroken chain of player pieces  (e.g., meeples, ships, populated planets, etc.) contributes to an attack or defense value.

The game was created by two young girls, 11 and 7 in 2014, as a project assigned by their father in order to get them off of YouTube while on vacation.

name: Imperium Chronicles: In Harm's Way Tactics
description:
In Harm's Way Tactics is a turn-based tactical combat game set in a science fantasy universe called the Imperium Chronicles. Up to five players choose from six different characters, each representing a class: Assassin, Duelist, Grunt, Medic, Officer, and Psi Mage. The game includes at least three ways to play, including quick skirmishes, missions, or a campaign. Solo play is also supported.

name: Chi
description:
Chi is a light card game that combines both strategy and take-that elements.

In Chi you play the role of a Zen Master trying to maximize your Yang Chi energy.

The game ends when one player has six unique Yang cards in front of their play area.

Players earn points by the total number of Points on each Yang Card they have in play, in addition they also earn 1 point for each remaining card in their hand.

The highest points wins. The player who caused the game to end may not necessarily be the winner.

On your turn you only perform one action, either take a card or play a card.

Very easy to learn and easy to play.

name: Rubber Road
description: Rubber Road is a connection game which uses rubber bands as the game pieces. The object of the game is to continuously connect opposing sides, while your opponent tries to do the same in the perpendicular direction. Opposing color rubber bands may not overlap. The best games are those with simple rules, but deep and complex strategies. Anyone can learn to play Rubber Road in 2 minutes, but mastering it will take a lifetime.

name: Playa Pirata
description:
This game has been published by dV Giochi as a reward for winning the 2013/2014 edition of the Gioco Inedito – Best Unpublished game contest. giocoinedito@luccacomicsandgames.com

name: Nation Builder
description:
Nation Builder is a game that puts players in the position of administering a small nation that is struggling to survive in the shadow of the world's super powers. The world has been shaken by an economic meltdown. The power void left over has given your nation the ability to grow without the usual pressure caused by the larger powers.  But they will not be idle for long.

Part of the challenge is running against the clock. You have a limited time to build up your own country and defend it against the political interference of your fellow gamers, as well as the constant meddling of the super nations of USA, China, Russia, and the European Bloc.

This Deck-Builder game brings in all the elements of managing Populations, Technology, Military, Social issues, Infrastructure, and Economics.  By the time you have played this game to the end you will have a much deeper understanding of the problems facing real world leaders.  Smaller countries of the world often struggle against the odds to become successful and independent in the face of outside interference. Can you take on the task? It is a difficult balancing act.  One wrong move and the game can be your enemy just as easily as the people sitting next to you.

name: Arf!
description:
You’re volunteers at an adoption fair trying to find the best homes for your shelter’s puppies! You will present each puppy with a set of cards which represent a home you’ve found. Each home offers different amounts of Food, Love, or Room in varying combinations.

Goal: The player who offers the best home gets to keep a record of that adoption in their portfolio. Score points by collecting cards with matching ranks, suits, and breeds. The player with the most points wins!

How to Play: On your turn, you may draw two cards and allow your opponents to draw one. OR you may offer a set of cards to a puppy that is available from the center of the table or in front of another player. Your offer must meet certain minimum requirements noted by the puppy's tag. If taking a puppy from an opponent, you must offer a *better* set of cards, again based on the puppy's tag. If you begin your turn with a puppy in front of you, then add that card to your portfolio where it will be scored at the end of the game.

name: Parasite
description:
My God, they're everywhere!
Or are they? An alien parasite has infected crew members of the ISS Fluffy Pink Cloud. Seeking comfort in each other's company, the crew members try to fight off the treacherous invader. Will Bartholomew Broadside and his trusty crewmen be in time to halt this spreading disease?

The players are crew members of the ISS Fluffy Pink Cloud. An alien infection is spreading through the ship and some players may already be infected when the game starts. It is not clear, however, who is infected and who isn't. Each turn, each player visits another player in his/her quarters, to protect the fellow crew member from infection (or, alternatively, to infect him).

On board are engineers (who can perform a body scan), a doctor (who can surgically remove an alien and perform a blood transfusion) and the doctor's assistant. Each turn, the players vote on who is going to perform which action and on whom, to clear the infection. However, among the voting crew memebers are those that are already infected and who want to infect the entire crew. Other players each have a special ability they can use to spread or to stop the infection. The end of the game (which has as much turns as players) is either a victory for the aliens or the humans.

name: Ready for Weather
description:
What is today's weather? Is it rainy, snowy, windy, or sunny? Play this game and you will be ready for any weather!

This game appears to be a roll and move with a spinner for movement. The sub-title is "a matching game", and the board shows both articles of clothing and weather conditions.

name: Fujian Trader
description:
Fujian Trader is a victory-point based, gateway game. The theme and mechanics are based upon the re-discovered Selden Map which depicts trading routes in China and had been lost for nearly 300 years. In Fujian Trader, players assume the role of Ming-era merchant families following trading routes in the East China Sea. Victory-points are gained by trading (or raiding) the goods of iron, silk, and rice for silver and influence. To win, players must accrue the most victory-points in order to successfully endure the Manchu invasion and subsequent Ming Empire collapse at the end of the game.

The game board is divided up into six different regions separated into six different colors. Each region has several ports. Players start out with a number of ports (dependent on the number of players) and may receive goods based off of which ports they control. When ports produce goods depends on the roll of a colored die. The color the die lands on coincides with the six colored regions and determines which produces goods for that round. Players may purchase additional ports with money gained from trading or incite rebellions in already controlled ports to wrestle them from an opponent.

The game ends after the Manchu first invade the Ming Empire. The invasion starts once the last of three Manchu Move cards is drawn from the Event deck. Players then have a three rounds to trade goods and two rounds to store silver, thus accruing victory-points. After the third round of the invasion the game ends, and players tally up victory points to determine who wins.

name: California Water Crisis
description:
Can you solve the drought? California Water Crisis is an educational game about California water politics. Take the role of one of California's three main regions (NorCal, SoCal, and the Central Valley) and try to find a solution to the fundamental cause of California's drought: there's more water demand than there's water.

Based on extensive research on California water history and current conditions, California Water Crisis will expose you to real world challenges such as special interest groups, groundwater depletion, and population growth.

Providing realism and replay value, the 3 regions have different starting resources, weaknesses, and potential strategies.  This game takes about 10 minutes to learn and about 40-60 minutes to play.  In addition to the main game, there are also two scenarios: one set in the late 1800s in the bad old days of reckless resource exploitation, and a cooperative scenario set in the mid 21st century.

name: Magia Cum Laude
description:
The apprentices of the Academy of Babas came together to fulfill their master exam. For this purpose, each of them has received a test spell, which consists of a certain composition of six energy stones. Now they have to collect the stones, which are spread on the floor tiles of the tower. But this is not as easy as you thought, as well as the other apprentices and one or the other of the masters want to have this energy, too.

Magia Cum Laude is about a magical test. Each player takes the role of a magician that can interfere with the test event in the tower. He is doing this by playing movement cards with which he can move both, each apprentice, as well as the Master. Each magician would also like that the apprentices also fulfill a secret spell for them and, of course, every magician also has two favorite students, whom he'd like to complete their examination successfully.

The game ends either a magician succeeded in making his two students pass their test or the time has expired. This happens when the deck of movement cards is empty. The magician who generated the most victory points wins.
